column5: If you have vision benefits... claim them. Can't beat free.

If you have never used them, you wouldn't know the difference. After using them, I will never go back to cheap sunglasses.  I have a pair of Oakley fishing specific straight jackets with Shallow Blue Irridium lenses that are 2 years old and still kicking. I just bought a pair of Revo Guide Small glasses with the shallow water lense and don't like them near as much as my old oakleys. I keep both on me when fishing though as the oakleys are great for overcast days and the Revo's work great when downright sunny.  When I used to buy $20.00 glasses, I would break them within a week. I usually end up losing them now before even coming close to breaking them. For the record, I have lost 3 pairs in 6 years so by the time I "lose" them, I am ready for a new pair anyway.
im sure once you drop a few couple hundred on a pair you'll take the extra effort/precaution to not lose or damage them.  i know i would
Cheap and quality optics don't belong in the same sentence.   I'd gladly drop another $2XX on a pair of Maui Jims if I drop mine in the lake tomorrow.
Doesn`t say that those lenzes are polarized.  Just sayin..
Furthermore, that original price seems steep for non-polarized lenzes.

That's because they aren't polarized. Look nice but useless fer fishin' Oakley has a bunch of non-polarized glasses. If you want the same ones but polarized add another  $100.  http://www.westmarine.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/ProductDisplay?productId=945435&catalogId=10001&langId=-1&storeId=11151&storeNum=51066&subdeptNum=51084&classNum=51087#.UiokhH92mM0
Yes it is steep as most of the Oakley shades in non-polarized are in the $125-$150 range and the polarized are $190-$220 range most places.
Sounds like highway robbery to me.
KVD Batwolfs rock

exactly.  i used to buy the cheapo ones that i'd end up losing.  once i got my costa del mars, i was much more careful with them.. and i still have them 4 years later.  and they are night and day compared to the cheapos in terms of vision.  never go back to the el cheapos.
I've been wearing the same pair of H2Optics for 7 or 8 years now and their still in great shape. Never could understand why folks pay big money for things and don't look after them.

I too had a pair of h2optics for about 5-6 years and they were awesome. Until I kneeled on them ice fishing  .dumass. I bought a pair of Bluewater optics to replace them and they are also quite nice. They'll last for many years with proper care.
I just added a pair of Costa's to my stable of shades tonight.

EXACTLY! If you buy a "cheap-o" pair for $20, you treat them exactly like that as well. When you realize that good quality glasses/lenses are head and shoulders above the cheap ones, you'll fork out the cash and MAKE SURE to take care of them. Sure, s##t happens and you could lose/break them but if you drop $200+ on a pair of glasses.... trust me... you'll take care of them as best you can.  I dont know about anyone else, but if I have a bait/hook/weight flying at my face at mach 3... I dont want to trust $20 plastic lenses to protect my eyes! Always remember... you get what you pay for.
Finally broke down and purchased some quality eyeware...Costa  man o war with the 580 lens. It's like everything is in HD.  Lets see how long it takes me too lose/break them.
Got a pair of Tifosi sunglasses at the local golf store. $134.  great polarized glasses, hard case with three different sets of lens and the lens have a breathing vent near the rim.  Love them.  Bill
To keep with the topic,what do you use to clean the lenses?.Is there a all around decent cleaner?. That would minimize streaking or fading.
I plan on using the cloth and cleaner that I get from the optometrist.

Hey guys ive lost my good pair of H2O sunglasses that I got from le baron and they no longer have any or simmilar style best $50 sunglasses  so im currious to what you guys recommend looking to spend $50-$120 will be using them for driving and fishing  thanks in Advance
Ryders You can find them at Sail or your local Running Room store MSRP for polarized ones go for $70 Nothing else in that price range that I know of with better quality
Try searching the site this subject comes up fairly often.

Gagnons were clearing out h2o optics sunglasses for $25 I believe? I recently bought a pair of numa and I'm happy with them. I did take some pics on my blog if you're interested to see how they look through the lens
Costas are awesome, can find just above your price range on the auction site.

I just came back from optic stores i did try pair of Maui Jim perfect fit and tint but for $480 is a bit hard since im unemployed at the momment , i tried costas just didn't like the way they sit on my face so for now have to find something thats half decent for $120 max  i just checked out gagons website they have the eyewear section empty

I have several pairs of Maui Jim's and never paid more than $180 I didn't know they went that expensive but regardless  I have had lots of brands and still do and they are still my fav but I have a few $50 pairs of strike kings and an h2o optics and I like those as well !!!! It's all in the lenses and you get what you pay for the Maui Jim's are by far the clearest sharpest lens that I have and they last too really good frames too

Bottom line here is that everyone is happy with their brand of choice. Clearly your $15.00 polarized glasses from walmart can be beat, but I don't think that you need to spend 2 or 300 bucks on a pair either. For the record, I'm a fan of Skeleton Optics. Zeiss lenses, and when on sale are dirt cheap. Look them up and get on their email list. Lots of 50% off sales which will get you a set of good glasses for about 50 bucks.
didn't know zeiss made sunglasses gotta check that out thanks

i have a set of spotters, from australia as i do a lot of saltwater flats fishing they cut the flats glare like no other i have found you can get into those for around 150.  as for maui jims i have those as well and love the fit. and i have never seen them at 480 sure you werent looking at the perscripton lenses.
Numa
We still have H2O glasses "some" we are clearing out. For your price range the Numa's would be a good bet. Excellent warranty and quality made.
I bought a pair of $50 sundogs from MEC and couldnt be happier... They work incredibly well!
I actually need a good pair myself. Welcome back my friend.
Still sell the h20 at sail. But my choice is oakley for the quality
So Kevin, NUMA glasses help you catch smallies? ha. I'm definitely gonna check out the NUMA glasses.  Thanks for the helpful info regarding the shades. Your site is also awesome! Keep it up!
Im leaning towards the NUMA i'll take a drive tommrow morning to sail see if they anything i like thanks for all the input guys much apreciated tight lines

I have a pair of Hugo Boss sunglasses that I paid about $440 for. (Paid extra to get polarized lenses) The screws for the ear stems keep getting loose or falling out, so I found a new use for them. Keeping dust off the top left corner of my fridge. I have about 7 or 8 pairs of cheap plastic sunglasses from Princess Auto. $1.99 each. $1.00 when on sale. They work as good as some $20 and $30 sunglasses I've had and if I break or lose a pair, no panic, no tears, no cursing. I simply grab another pair I have in the car, boat or house and go on with my day.  I would like to fix and use the Hugo Boss polarized sunglasses, but no hurry, no worries. I know where to find them.
KVD Oakley's.... best glasses I've ever owned.

I have oakleys and ya their great, but I also got sundogs, and their pretty good too. Lots of choices, get the best you can for your money and invest in a case or something to protect them when not in use and the'll last for years.

I have glasses from Rayban, Habervision and Smith Action Optics and they're all good glasses. The best pair I ever owned were made by Ocean Waves, but they are at the bottom of the lake after wiping out on my buddies jet ski.

Heres my sunglasses pattern:  Buy 15 dollar sunglasses from drug store..... Sit on glasses. Go without glasses Buy another pair of 15 dollar glasses when desperately needed, on way to a fishing weekend.........drop glasses in lake Go without glasses for rest of trip Buy another pair of cheapos at truck stop while driving into the sun on road trip.........lose glasses at next rest stop Go without glasses until next road trip Buy another pair of..........you get the idea  Been doing it my whole life.........now imagine if all those glasses above were 120 dollar glasses  Ill never buy a quality pair of glasses

All done picked up a pair of suncloud aviators made by Smith from sail for $70 and another cheap pair for hell of it I might go back and grab a pair of Riders in the coming weeks once they stock up some more. Thanks for all the input guys

just saw theese on a west marine clearnace  oakleys 120 bucks  http://www.westmarine.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/ProductDisplay?productId=945434&catalogId=10001&langId=-1&storeId=11151&storeNum=51066&subdeptNum=51084&classNum=51087
Wow you guys spend some cash!  I lose or break far too many to spend that kind of money.  And I must say "only $120 casue I am unemployed"  .......wow
